trans-unit.source: Creates a compatible bitmap (DDB) from a DIB and, optionally, sets the bitmap bits

seg-source.mrk: Creates a compatible bitmap (DDB) from a DIB and, optionally, sets the bitmap bits

target.mrk: Creates a compatible bitmap (DDB) from a DIB and, optionally, sets the bitmap bits

trans-unit.source: $tagBITMAPINFO structure that specifies various attributes of the DIB, including the bitmap dimensions and colors.

seg-source.mrk: $tagBITMAPINFO structure that specifies various attributes of the DIB, including the bitmap dimensions and colors.

target.mrk: $tagBITMAPINFO structure that specifies various attributes of the DIB, including the bitmap dimensions and colors.

trans-unit.source: Note that a positive value for the height indicates a bottom-up DIB while a negative value for the height indicates a top-down DIB.

seg-source.mrk: Note that a positive value for the height indicates a bottom-up DIB while a negative value for the height indicates a top-down DIB.

target.mrk: Note that a positive value for the height indicates a bottom-up DIB while a negative value for the height indicates a top-down DIB.

trans-unit.source: The type of colors used. This parameter must be one of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: This parameter must be one of the following values:

target.mrk: This parameter must be one of the following values:

trans-unit.source: [optional] A pointer to an array of bytes containing the initial bitmap data.

seg-source.mrk: A pointer to an array of bytes containing the initial bitmap data.

target.mrk: A pointer to an array of bytes containing the initial bitmap data.

trans-unit.source: the handle to the compatible bitmap that will be whatever bit depth a reference DC is.

seg-source.mrk: the handle to the compatible bitmap that will be whatever bit depth a reference DC is.

target.mrk: the handle to the compatible bitmap that will be whatever bit depth a reference DC is.

trans-unit.source: When you no longer need the bitmap, call the _WinAPI_DeleteObject() function to delete it.

seg-source.mrk: When you no longer need the bitmap, call the _WinAPI_DeleteObject() function to delete it.

target.mrk: When you no longer need the bitmap, call the _WinAPI_DeleteObject() function to delete it.
